channel.title: Associations :: CC 410 Textbook
channel.description: YouTube Video Video Materials Class diagrams also express the associations between classes by drawing lines between the boxes representing them. There are two basic types of associations we model with UML: has-a and is-a associations. We break these into two further categories, based on the strength of the association, which is either strong or weak. These associations are: Association Name Association Type Typical Usage Realization weak is-a Interfaces Generalization strong is-a Inheritance Aggregation weak has-a Collections Composition strong has-a Encapsulation Is-A Associations Is-a associations indicate a relationship where one class is a instance of another class.
